SENT.plain: A case of fatal disseminated infection caused by the dematiaceous hyphomycete Scedosporium prolificans diagnosed post mortem is reported in a 60-year-old male patient with acquired immunodeficiency syndrome who additionally suffered from Burkitt's lymphoma
The patient was significantly granulocytopenic following aggressive chemotherapy and irradiation
He developed dyspnoea at rest and chest pain despite a normal chest radiograph
Fluconazole treatment was carried out empirically because no sign of a fungal infection was detected ante mortem, either by mycological cultivation or by serological investigation
First post-mortem examination revealed a disseminated fungal infection involving the central nervous system
Scedosporium prolificans was cultured from the kidney, spleen and myocardium
In vitro, the fungal isolate was found to be highly resistant to all available systemic antimycotics
